instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message:
Hello,
today i am working on an 820-3115-B that wont boot. It turns on, dvd drive makes its "sound" but no chime, no Boot, no Backlight and no picture. Also its not working on an external display. SMC reset is also not possible (tried with external keyboard too). There are some slightly brown pads on the board but no waterdamage. From there i have no idea where to look next.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: CPU Vcore present??

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: vcore is 0,93V and cpu is getting warm (PCH also)

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: 0.95V on Vcore is the correct voltage for a board that is at least doing something. Does it beep without RAM, 4 pin speaker in the case needs to be connected.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Yes, it beeps 3 times without ram inside the case

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Try another BIOS, make sure to keep the original!

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Can i take the Bios from any other 820-3115-B?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: For testing you can, but if it works the original BIOS file will need to be fixed.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Ok, thank you. With new Bios it works. I´ll try to recover the original file. So this is fixed. Thanks

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: You can upload your original file here and I can fix it for you.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Unfortunately i dont have a BIOS reader yet. I wan to buy one soon. I send these out to somebody who can fix these. But grerat to know that you would do it here. If i have Bios problems again i´ll let you know. Thanks alot.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Just buy a $30 TL866 and do this yourself. Who knows what the other guy is doing to the ME region and stuff. Do it yourself and get it done 100% correct.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message:
I just bought one. It should arrive on Friday. I´ll try to read and upload the BIOS here because i have no clue how i can fix a BIOS file myself... Thank you very much!!
I think i got this wrong but i noticed that the TL866 can also read eg. TSOP48 ICs. Means that, that it can read the data stored on TSOP48 Flash ICs (like the 8 or 16 GB modules used in USB-Sticks) with this programmer too?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Depends on the exact type, check supported chips. You will need an adaptor for that too of course.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message:
The reader arrived today and i read the BIOS. I am not sure if i did it correct but here is the file.

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CDSZlbnEHxywrMA1gDuMSmwQ39L14G75/view?usp=sharing[/url]

Thank you!

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: That's an empty file....Could be empty chip or bad connection, does it recognize the chip ID?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: No. It does not recognize the ID and only reads the chip without the ID check...

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Then there is a bad connection. Without ID it will not work.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message:
My bad... I did it again and this time it worked...  New file is here.

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M6W5qWxw_OcVV9bM9aKiHHudA5hRjHhm/view[/url]

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Still a mostly empty file....There is some data but it is still not usable.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message:
How much has to be in this file? i did it a couple more times and this is the best result i could achive.. Could it be a bad ICs?

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Kd9DPzxvBSmDjX8IacwzWl7GwP8ETssl/view?ts=5a872b1c[/url]

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message:
That looks like a complete file. You just have to wonder why the other ones failed, this should normally be a very reliable process. 

Here is the fixed BIOS:
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1VnyhjzrvXBti6vPL8NaPm9nevHe-Xycl[/url]

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Thank you. I guess my TL866 has some problems. Today it wont read any IDs and the self test fails with an overcurrent ERROR... So i send it back and wait for the new one to arrive...I´ll let you know it the file works if i have the new reader here...

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Self test without chip installed?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Yes, without chip installed. I also disconnected the cable from the 40 pin interafce to be sure tht thats not the issue.. The error comes only up at one pin. I did it at least 10 times and everytime the same error... Maybe thats why it gave me different readings from the same chip yesterday...

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message:
No Title

New programmer arrived. Self test works this time. I tried your fixed file on 2 different chips from 820-3115-B donors and on the original IC. Before that i read the progeramm again from the original chip. All three failed during programming with different errors. I attached two of the Errors. But ID check always works now and i can read and programm all ICs without problems. I also attached the file i saved from the original Chip with the new programmer. Maybe that one is deiiferent from theole ones...

[URL="https://deref-gmx.net/mail/client/3v4AYH0U7cI/dereferrer/?redirectUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fdrive.google.com%2Ffile%2Fd%2F0B5EhUh5agFcuSUJiNG0zMFR4MEpNQjdRSDBwLW5CbmtCSWhF%2Fview%3Fusp%3Ddrivesdk"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5EhUh5agFcuSUJiNG0zMFR4MEpNQjdRSDBwLW5CbmtCSWhF/view?usp=drivesdk[/URL]

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: Try another chip, it could be a flaky chip.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: I get another error like the ones shown in my last post if i try another chip ... I tried 5 ICs already.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message:
Flaky connections in your adapter. MX chips are 100% known to work, I believe there may be some issues with the Q064 ones.
Maybe USB port not supplying enough current. TL866 normally works very well and easy.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: I tried few more times and it always fails. But it fails not during programming. It fails during verifying... Original IC was Q064. I took a Q064 from another 820-3115-B programmed it (it failed again) and soldered it on to the board and it seems to work normally so far. It boots up fine and runs for 2 hours now without noticable problems. But if i am right bad BIOS can cause a lot more Problems even if it boots up fine... So would you suggest i keep on trying (maybe with an onboard USB 3 port) or will it be fine now?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: I have no idea. It should not fail during verify! Try another computer, I use my TL866 with WIN7 64 bit with no issues.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no Boot
threads.message: I tried win 10 pro and win 7 pro 64 Bit as well as another pc and i get everytime an error during verification... But the device still runs just fine...
